messages.subject: Re: Re; Game instructions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/28/99 9:34:44 PM Central Daylight Time, MrsMattie@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/28/99 9:34:44 PM Central Daylight Time,
MrsMattie@... writes:

<< Does anyone have the instructions to the game "Where in the World?" (Not
Carmen Sandiego, but the Aristoplay one.)

If so, would you be prepared to photocopy them and send them to me, or to
let
me borrow them to copy, please? Naturally I'd pay photocopying and postage
costs.
>>


Mattie,
I also have the game. I noticed that you got a few replies, so I will
see if you get the instructions from someone else first. If for some reason
you don't get them (if their house is anything like mine :), they may not be
able to locate it), just let me know. Hey, I was wondering, do you have a
printer? I have a scanner, so I could scan the instructions and e-mail them
to you, so you could print them up. It would be alot faster than snail mail.
If you want me to do that, just e-mail me privately at FreeSchool@....
:)
Tami

you could check Aritoplay's website and ask them to send you a copy
www.aristoplay.com
Debra

messages.subject: Re; Game instructions
messages.msgSnippet: Does anyone have the instructions to the game Where in the World? (Not Carmen Sandiego, but the Aristoplay one.) If so, would you be prepared to photocopy
messages.messageBody:
Does anyone have the instructions to the game "Where in the World?" (Not
Carmen Sandiego, but the Aristoplay one.)

If so, would you be prepared to photocopy them and send them to me, or to let
me borrow them to copy, please? Naturally I'd pay photocopying and postage
costs.

As the people asking for autographs always say:
"It's not for me, it's for someone else." :-)

Best wishes
Mattie
